HTML.title: Create a Heading
HTML.description: Write an H1 tag that says 'Hello World'.
HTML.explanation: The <h1> tag defines the most important heading. In this case, it displays 'Hello World' as a top-level heading.
HTML.hint: Use <h1> for the largest heading in HTML.

HTML.title: Create an Unordered List
HTML.description: Write an unordered list that contains three list items: 'HTML', 'CSS', and 'JavaScript'.
HTML.explanation: The <ul> tag is used to define an unordered list, and <li> tags are used for each list item. This displays the three technologies in a bulleted list format.
HTML.hint: Use <ul> for the unordered list and <li> for each list item.

HTML.title: Add a Button
HTML.description: Create a button that says 'Click Me'.
HTML.explanation: The <button> tag is used to create clickable buttons.
HTML.hint: Use the <button> tag with the label inside it.

CSS.title: Change Text Color
CSS.description: Write CSS that changes the color of the heading to blue.
CSS.explanation: The 'color' property sets the text color of the h1 element. Here, it changes the text to blue.
CSS.hint: Use the 'color' property and target the 'h1' element.

CSS.title: Style a Heading
CSS.description: Make all h1 headings red and centered.
CSS.explanation: Color changes the text and text-align centers it.

CSS.title: Add Padding
CSS.explanation: 'padding' adds space inside the element border.

JAVASCRIPT.title: Change Text with JavaScript
JAVASCRIPT.description: Change the text inside the paragraph with id='demo' to 'Welcome!'.
JAVASCRIPT.explanation: We use 'getElementById' to access and modify the text.

JAVASCRIPT.title: Add Click Event
JAVASCRIPT.description: Make the button say 'Clicked!' when clicked.
JAVASCRIPT.starterCode:
<button onclick="myFunc()">Click Me</button>
<script>
function myFunc() {
  // Start here
}
</script>
JAVASCRIPT.explanation: When the button is clicked, it triggers a function that changes its text.
JAVASCRIPT.hint: Use querySelector and innerText inside the function.

JAVASCRIPT.title: Add a New Element
JAVASCRIPT.description: Use JavaScript to add a new paragraph saying 'Hello JS!' to the body.
JAVASCRIPT.solution:
<script>
const p = document.createElement('p');
p.innerText = 'Hello JS!';
document.body.appendChild(p);
</script>
JAVASCRIPT.explanation: Create a new element and append it to the DOM using JavaScript.
